class picnic.workflows.image_workflows.ImageWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

A parent class to the individual image convertion modules. Most of the steps will be the same across converters (finding jsons, merging multiple images, etc.). This creates a parent class keep the same steps, but overload the critical “convert_to_nii” method.

The public attributes that are important: wf - the nipype.Workflow

DEFAULT_INFLOWS = {'in_files': []}
DEFAULT_PARAMS = {'name': 'nibabel_image_import', 'report': True}
build_workflow(sink_directory)[source]

create a nipype workflow to convert all images provided to a standard imaging file type (nii or nii.gz)

Parameters

sink_directory - file-like str

The sink filepath or ‘’

returns - custom_workflow_constructors.NipibipyWorkflow obj

convert_to_nii()[source]

this will be overloaded by all its children

create_report()[source]

create a report

merge_all_images()[source]

combine all the reoriented images to one volume and rename the file

search_for_jsons()[source]

search for any associated jsons

class picnic.workflows.image_workflows.NibabelLoadWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

load an image image using nibabel

convert_to_nii()[source]

use nibabel to load an image modality, extract its affine and resave it as a nifti gz

class picnic.workflows.camra_workflows.CamraWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

C-AMRA (Coregistration - Automated Multi-Run Approach) is complex and requires a couple different steps. This parent class will contain the repeatable steps. The children classes contain the unique steps.

The public attributes that are important: wf - the nipype.Workflow

DEFAULT_INFLOWS = {'4d_image': None, 'brain': None, 'ct': None, 'gmmask': None, 't1': None, 'wmmask': None}
DEFAULT_PARAMS = {'cost': 'mutualinfo', 'crop_end': False, 'crop_start': False, 'ct': False, 'dof': 6, 'name': 'lcf_camra', 'rank': 1, 'report': True, 'search_angle': 35, 'smooth': 0}
build_workflow(sink_directory)[source]

create a nipype workflow to run freesurfer’s reconall

Parameters

sink_directory - file-like str

The sink filepath or ‘’

returns - custom_workflow_constructors.NipibipyWorkflow obj

coregister()[source]

coregister each source to each target using different registration softwares

create_brainmask_from_t1()[source]

create a brainmask using BET

create_gm_and_wmmasked_t1()[source]

create a target image for the combined masks of grey and white masks

create_probabilistic_mask()[source]

create a target image where we artificially lower the white matter intensities by half, keep the grey matter the same and zero out everything else

create_report()[source]

create a report

crop_image()[source]

use nibabel to crop the image

gmmask_t1()[source]

create a target image for the gmmask-ed t1

pet_brainmask_from_ct()[source]

create a brainmask from the ct

Parameters

pick_best_coregistration()[source]

this will be overloaded by all its children

rename_outputs()[source]

standardize the filenames to the workflow name

reorient_in_files()[source]

make sure all the images given are niftis and have diagnoal affines

segment_t1()[source]

segment the t1 using FAST

class picnic.workflows.camra_workflows.LcfCamraWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

child object using flirt to motion correct

pick_best_coregistration()[source]

use the Lowest Cost Function (LCF) method to pick the best coregistration

class picnic.workflows.custom_workflow_constructors.NipibipyNode(node, outflows)[source]

a helper to associated node with the outflows

The sole purpose of this is to keep track of the outflow so connecting them later will be easier

class picnic.workflows.custom_workflow_constructors.NipibipyWorkflow(name, outflows, sink_directory='')[source]

Nipibipy custom workflows

By leveraging nipype’s workflow system we have some helper methods to build workflows as the module is being assembled. Most of the heavy lifting is being done by the add_node and add_mapnode methods.

The public attributes that are important:

workflow - the nipype.Workflow assigned to the module

add_mapnode(interface, name, inflows, outflows, iterfield, to_sink=None)[source]

add a mapnode to the current workflow

Parameters

interface - Nipype interface

the Node interface. ex - Function, Dcm2niix, FLIRT, etc.

name - str

the node name

inflows - dict

pairing of the required inputs and where they are connecting from

outflows - tuple

the node outputs. There is no pair because the doesn’t (to this point) know where to connect them

iterfield - list

a list of all the field that should be iterated

to_sink - list

list of all the outflows that should be sunk

add_node(interface, name, inflows, outflows, to_sink=None)[source]

add a node to the current workflow

Parameters

interface - nipype interface

the Node interface. ex - Function, Dcm2niix, FLIRT, etc.

name - str

the node name

inflows - dict

pairing of the required inputs and where they are connecting from ex {‘in_file’ : ‘workflow_step_1.out_file’} or {‘idx’ : 1}

outflows - tuple

the node outputs. There is no pair because the doesn’t (to this point) know where to connect them

to_sink - list

list of all the outflows that should be sunk

assign_node_inputs(node_name, inflows)[source]

assign the node inflows. Either find its connection to another node or assign the string, int, etc

Parameters

node_name - str

name of the node

inflows - dict

pairing of the required inputs and where they are connecting from

connect_nodes(in_node_name, in_connection, out_node_name, out_connection)[source]

connect two nodes together

Parameters

in_node_name - str

the name of the node being connected

in_connection - str

the name of the connection

out_node_name - str

the name of the node doing the connecting

out_connection - str

the name of the connection

run(base_dir=None)[source]

shortcut to run the workflow that has already been built

Parameters

base_dir - file-like str

the location to store the intermediate temp files

sink_outflows(node_name_being_sunk, outflows)[source]

sink the designated outflows

Parameters

node_name_being_sunk - str

the name of the node being sunk

outflows - list (or other iterable)

a list of the outputs to sink

class picnic.workflows.pvc_workflows.PvcWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

A parent class to the individual image convertion modules. Most of the steps will be the same across converters (finding jsons, merging multiple images, etc.). This creates a parent class keep the same steps, but overload the critical “convert_to_nii” method.

The public attributes that are important: wf - the nipype.Workflow

DEFAULT_INFLOWS = {'in_files': []}
DEFAULT_PARAMS = {'name': 'nibabel_image_import', 'report': True}

class picnic.workflows.motioncorrection_workflows.MotionCorrectionWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

A parent class for all the different motion correction methods. Most of the steps will be the same across all types of this module (reorienting base image, cropping, merging). This creates a parent class keep the same steps, but overload the areas that differ across methods

The public attributes that are important: wf - the nipype.Workflow

DEFAULT_INFLOWS = {'in_file': None}
DEFAULT_PARAMS = {'cost': 'corratio', 'crop_end': False, 'crop_start': False, 'mean': False, 'name': 'mcflirt_moco', 'ref_vol': 8, 'report': True, 'search_angle': 0, 'smooth': 4}
build_workflow(sink_directory)[source]

create a nipype workflow to run freesurfer’s reconall

Parameters

sink_directory - file-like str

The sink filepath or ‘’

returns - custom_workflow_constructors.NipibipyWorkflow obj

create_report()[source]

create a report

crop_image()[source]

use nibabel to crop the image

motion_correct()[source]

this will be overloaded by all its children

rename_outputs()[source]

standardize the filenames to the workflow name

reorient_in_file()[source]

make sure the base image given to the motion correction module is a nifti and in a diagonal affine

class picnic.workflows.reconall_workflows.ReconallWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

A parent class to all the individual reconall statuses. Most of the steps will be the same across all types of this module (running/finding freesurfer subject, reorienting important images, generate reports) This creates a parent class keep the same steps, but overload the critical “execute_reconall” method.

The public attributes that are important: wf - the nipype.Workflow

DEFAULT_INFLOWS = {'filepath': None, 'flair': None, 't1s': [], 't2': None}
build_workflow(sink_directory)[source]

create a nipype workflow to run freesurfer’s reconall

Parameters

sink_directory - file-like str

The sink filepath or ‘’

returns - custom_workflow_constructors.NipibipyWorkflow obj

create_report()[source]

create a report

execute_reconall()[source]

this will be overloaded by all its children

generate_bilateral_rois()[source]

using a lookup table (defined as a static file in the nipibipy’s sub-package) create a bilateral atlas and associated json for the pre-determined atlases

generate_gray_matter_mask()[source]

create the gray matter mask by including some rois from the aseg

generate_subcortical_mask()[source]

create the white matter mask by including some rois from the aseg

generate_ventricle_mask()[source]

create the white matter mask by including some rois from the aseg

generate_white_matter_mask()[source]

create the white matter mask by including some rois from the aseg

generate_wholebrain_mask()[source]

create a whole brain mask from the aseg

reorient_outflows()[source]

combine all the reoriented images to one volume and rename the file

class picnic.workflows.tacs_workflows.TacsWorkflow(params, inflows)[source]

A parent class to the individual image convertion modules. Most of the steps will be the same across converters (finding jsons, merging multiple images, etc.). This creates a parent class keep the same steps, but overload the critical “convert_to_nii” method.

The public attributes that are important: wf - the nipype.Workflow

DEFAULT_INFLOWS = {'4d_image': None, 'atlas': []}
DEFAULT_PARAMS = {'name': 'nibabel_image_import', 'report': True, 'units': 'uci'}
